revised_title: Elastic Scattering of Deuterons by Light Elements: A Study of Range and Energy
tldr: This article presents experiments on the elastic scattering of 6.5 MeV deuterons by deuterium, helium, and other light elements. The authors analyze the range and energy of the scattered particles, finding that terms contribute to the amplitude of the scattered wave. The study provides insights into the range-energy relation for the photographic emulsion used and supports the assumption of a constant stopping power for protons and deuterons.
